Pre-Game Insights: The Lone Star, having failed to win any of the previous six meetings between the two nations, will be aiming to break that trend and secure their first victory of the campaign.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Liberia is currently on a five-game unbeaten streak across all competitions, with three draws and two wins, including a 1-0 victory over São Tomé and Príncipe in the 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers.
Others: Riyad Mahrez will miss the match due to injury, but Baghdad Bounedjah, who is one goal shy of Mahrez’s tally for the Greens, is expected to lead the attack alongside Saïd Benrahma.
Liberia’s coach Mario Marinica is expected to field a similar lineup to the one that faced Togo, with Peter Wilson, Terry Sackor, and captain Oscar Dorley leading the Lone Star’s attack.
